TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DataObjectCopyingEventArgs extends System.Windows.DataObjectEventArgs

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.Copying> event occurs when a copy operation has finished converting the selected content into all specified data formats, has stored all data formats in the associated data object, and is ready to put the data object on the system clipboard or to begin a drag operation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.IDataObject dataObject, bool isDragDrop) cil managed

Docs.param: A <see cref="T:System.Windows.DataObject"> containing data ready to be copied.

A `Boolean` value indicating whether the copy is part of a drag-and-drop operation. `true` to indicate that the copy is part of a drag-and-drop operation; otherwise, `false`. If this parameter is set to `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.Copying> event fires when dragging is initiated.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.DataObjectCopyingEventArgs> object is typically created by the application that is initiating the copy operation.

Docs.summary: Gets the data object associated with the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.Copying> event.
Docs.value: The data object associated with the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.Copying> event.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void InvokeEventHandler (Delegate genericHandler, object genericTarget);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void InvokeEventHandler(class System.Delegate genericHandler, object genericTarget) cil managed
